## BigQuery Integration


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/integrations/bigquery


# BigQuery Integration

Export your Sealmetrics data to Google BigQuery for custom SQL analysis, machine learning, and integration with your data warehouse.

## Prerequisites

- Sealmetrics Growth plan or above
- Google Cloud Platform (GCP) account
- BigQuery API enabled in GCP
- GCP service account with BigQuery permissions

## Setup Overview

1. Create a GCP service account
2. Grant BigQuery permissions
3. Generate and download credentials
4. Configure in Sealmetrics
5. Choose sync settings
6. Verify data export

## Step 1: Create GCP Service Account

### In Google Cloud Console

1. Go to [console.cloud.google.com](https://console.cloud.google.com)
2. Select your project (or create one)
3. Navigate to **IAM & Admin â†’ Service Accounts**
4. Click **+ Create Service Account**

```
Service Account Details:
  Name: sealmetrics-export
  ID: sealmetrics-export
  Description: Service account for Sealmetrics BigQuery export
```

5. Click **Create and Continue**

## Step 2: Grant Permissions

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/integrations/bigquery]



## Pixel Builder


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/tracking/pixel-builder


# Pixel Builder

The Pixel Builder helps you generate customized tracking code for your website without writing code manually.

## Accessing Pixel Builder

1. Click the **gear icon** in the main navigation
2. Select **Tracking â†’ Pixel Builder**

## Basic Configuration

### Step 1: Select Account

Choose which account this pixel will track to:

```
Account: [My E-commerce Store            â–¼]

Account ID: acc_1234567890abcdef
Tracking Domain: track.mystore.com
```

### Step 2: Tracking Features

Enable/disable tracking features:

```
Tracking Features
â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”

â˜‘ Automatic pageview tracking
  Track page loads automatically

â˜‘ SPA support (Single Page Applications)
  Track virtual navigation in React, Vue, etc.

â˜‘ Scroll depth tracking
  Track how far users scroll (25%, 50%, 75%, 100%)

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/tracking/pixel-builder]



## Roles & Permissions


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/user-management/roles-management


# Roles & Permissions

Sealmetrics uses a two-tier role system to give you fine-grained control over who can access what:

1. **Organization roles** control what a user can do across the organization (manage members, billing, settings).
2. **Site-level roles** control what a user can do within a specific site (edit configuration or view only).

These two layers are independent and combine together to determine a user's full set of permissions.

---

## Organization Roles

Every member of an orga

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/user-management/roles-management]



## How to Add Domains to Your Site


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/account-setup/how-to-add-domains


# How to Add Domains to Your Site

Domains define which websites are authorized to send tracking data to your Sealmetrics site. You need at least one domain configured for tracking to work.

Sealmetrics counts a new **entrance** when the referrer is empty or comes from a different domain than your own (e.g., facebook.com â†’ yoursite.com).

---

## Add a Domain During Site Creation

When you create a new site, you can add one or more domains in the creation form:

1. Go to **Settings â†’ Sites** in 

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/account-setup/how-to-add-domains]



## Users & Teams


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/account/users


# Users & Teams

Manage who has access to your Sealmetrics organization and control what they can see and do.

---

## Viewing Members

To see all members in your organization:

1. Go to **Settings** (gear icon in the navigation)
2. Navigate to **Organization** and select your organization
3. Open the **Members** tab

You will see a list of all current members, their email, organization role, and status.

---

## Inviting Members

Owners and Admins can invite new members to the organization.

##

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/account/users]



## Webhooks


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/integrations/webhooks


# Webhooks

Webhooks allow Sealmetrics to send real-time data to your servers or third-party services when specific events occur.

## What Are Webhooks?

Webhooks are HTTP callbacks that send data when events happen:

```
Event occurs in Sealmetrics
         â†“
Webhook triggered
         â†“
HTTP POST to your URL
         â†“
Your server processes data
```

## Accessing Webhook Settings

1. Go to **Settings â†’ Integrations â†’ Webhooks**
2. View configured webhooks

## Available Webhook Events

| Event | Trigger | Use Case |
|-------|---------|----------|
| `conversion.created` | New conversion recorded | Update CRM, send to ad platforms |
| `anomaly.detected` | LENS detects anomaly | Alert systems, incident management |
| `anomaly.resolved` | Anomaly returns to normal | Close incident tickets |
| `report.generated` | Scheduled report ready | Notify team, archive report |
| `threshold.exceeded` | Metric crosses threshold | Real-time alerting |

## Creating a Webhook

### Step 1: Add New Webhook

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/integrations/webhooks]



## Content Grouping


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/tracking/content-grouping


# Content Grouping

Content Grouping lets you organize your pages into logical categories, making it easier to analyze performance by section rather than individual URLs.

## What is Content Grouping?

Instead of analyzing hundreds of individual URLs:

```
Before Content Grouping:
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
/products/widget-a           234 views
/products/widget-b           189 views
/products/gadget-x           167 views
/blog/how-to-use-widgets     145 views
/blog/widget-comparison      132 views
/about                        89 views
... (hundreds more)
```

You can analyze by content type:

```
After Content Grouping:
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
Products                     1,234 views
Blog                           892 views
Company Pages                  345 views
Support                        234 views
```

## Accessing Content Grouping

1. Click the **gear icon** in the main navigation
2. Select **Tracking â†’ Content Grouping**

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/tracking/content-grouping]



## How to Add an Organization Admin


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/user-management/create-admin-user


# How to Add an Organization Admin

If you need another person to help manage your organization's members and sites, you can invite them as an **Admin**.

An Admin can:

- Access all sites in the organization
- Add, remove, and manage members
- Assign sites to Members
- View organization settings

Admins **cannot** manage billing or delete the organization -- only the Owner can do that.

## Steps

1. Go to **Settings > Organization > Members**
2. Click **Invite Member**
3. Enter the person's ema

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/user-management/create-admin-user]



## How to Find Your Site ID


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/account-setup/find-account-id


# How to Find Your Site ID

Your **Site ID** is a unique identifier assigned to each site in Sealmetrics. You need it to install the tracking pixel, configure API access, and set up integrations.

The Site ID is set when the site is created and **cannot be changed** afterwards.

---

## Steps to Find Your Site ID

### 1. Go to **Settings**

Click the **Settings** icon (gear) in the sidebar.

### 2. Open **Sites**

In the Settings menu, click on **Sites** to see your list of sites.

### 3. Select

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/account-setup/find-account-id]



## Custom Dimensions


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/tracking/custom-dimensions


# Custom Dimensions

Custom dimensions let you capture additional data beyond standard analytics fields, enabling business-specific analysis.

## What Are Custom Dimensions?

Standard tracking captures common fields:
- Page URL
- Referrer
- Device type
- Country

Custom dimensions let you add your own fields:
- User type (free/premium)
- Product category
- A/B test variant
- Customer segment

## Accessing Custom Dimensions

1. Click the **gear icon** in the main navigation
2. Select **Tracking â†’ Custom Dimensions**

## Dimension Types

### Hit-Level Dimensions

Attached to individual pageviews or events:

```
Dimension: Product Category
Scope: Hit
Example values: "Electronics", "Clothing", "Home"

Use case: Different pages show different categories
Each pageview can have a different value
```

### Session-Level Dimensions

Persist for the entire session:

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/tracking/custom-dimensions]



## How to Change Your Password


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/user-management/change-password


# How to Change Your Password

Follow these steps to update your password securely.

## 1. Open Your Profile

Click on your username in the top-right corner and select **My profile**.

![Change Password Step 1](/img/change-password-1.png)

## 2. Update Your Password

Inside the **User** section, update:

- Password  
- Password confirmation  

Click **Update** to save your changes.

---

If you cannot access your account, you can request a reset link from the login screen.



## How to Add a New Site


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/account-setup/how-to-add-new-account


# How to Add a New Site

Each site represents a website you want to track with Sealmetrics. Sites belong to an organization.

## Steps

1. Go to **Sites** in the sidebar
2. Click **Add Site**
3. Enter the site name (e.g., "My Blog" or "company.com")
4. Set the site's **timezone** â€” this determines how dates are calculated in your reports
5. Set the **currency** for conversion tracking (default: EUR)
6. Click **Create**

Your new site will appear in the Sites list with a unique **Site ID**.

---


... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/account-setup/how-to-add-new-account]



## How to Invite a Team Member


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/user-management/how-to-add-new-user


# How to Invite a Team Member

Owners and Admins can invite new members to the organization at any time.

## Steps

1. Go to **Settings > Organization > Members**
2. Click **Invite Member**
3. Enter the person's email address
4. Choose their organization role:
   - **Owner** -- full access including billing
   - **Admin** -- manage members and all sites, no billing
   - **Member** -- access only to assigned sites
5. If you selected **Member**, choose which sites they should have access to
6. Cli

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/user-management/how-to-add-new-user]



## How to Change Your Time Zone


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/account-setup/how-to-change-timezone


# How to Change Your Time Zone

The timezone determines how dates and times are calculated in your reports.

## Steps

1. Go to **Settings â†’ Sites** in the sidebar.
2. Click on the site you want to configure.
3. In the **General** tab, find the **Timezone** field.
4. Select your timezone from the dropdown (you can search by name).
5. Click **Save** to apply the change.

---

By default, new sites use **Europe/Madrid**. The timezone list is grouped by region (America, Europe, Asia, etc.) for easi

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/account-setup/how-to-change-timezone]



## LLM Settings


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/llm


# LLM Settings

Configure which AI model powers your LENS insights. By default, Sealmetrics uses a self-hosted DeepSeek model, but you can configure your own provider for potentially faster responses or specific model preferences.

## Accessing LLM Settings

1. Click the gear icon to open **Settings**
2. Click **LLM Settings** in the sidebar

## Default Configuration

By default, Sealmetrics uses **DeepSeek Local** via Ollama:

| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| **Provider** | Self-hosted DeepSeek (via Ollama) |
| **Cost** | Free (included in your plan) |
| **Privacy** | Maximum - data never leaves Sealmetrics infrastruct

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/settings/llm]



## Access Restricted to Authorized IPs


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/user-management/authorized-ips


# Access Restricted to Authorized IPs

Sealmetrics allows you to restrict platform access by IP address for maximum account security.

This feature is ideal for organizations requiring strict access control.

---

## How It Works

An Admin can define **authorized IP addresses**. Only devices connecting from those IPs can log into the platform.

Benefits:

- **Full access control**: Only trusted networks can access the platform.
- **Protection from unauthorized access**.
- **Extra security layer*

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/user-management/authorized-ips]



## How to Share Your Affiliate Link


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/affiliates-and-partners/how-to-share-your-affiliate-link


# How to Share Your Affiliate Link

Sealmetrics includes a simple affiliate system that lets you earn recurring commissions by referring new paid users.  
Follow the steps below to generate and share your unique affiliate link.

---

## Steps to Create Your Affiliate Link

1. Go to **Setup**
2. Select **Affiliate**
3. Enter the name you'd like to include in your affiliate link
4. Click **Create**
5. Share the generated link

---

## How Commissions Work

Every time someone becomes a **Paid User*

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/affiliates-and-partners/how-to-share-your-affiliate-link]



## Bypass POS or Referrer


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/tracking-and-attribution-settings/bypass-pos-or-referrer


# Bypass POS or Referrer

When a user completes a purchase through a **POS (Point of Sale)** or external payment page (Stripe, PayPal, Redsysâ€¦), they temporarily leave your site.  
When they return to your **thank-you page**, Sealmetrics may detect this as a new session and attribute the referrer incorrectly.

This causes conversions to appear as coming from:
âŒ *payment* instead of  
âœ”ï¸ the original source (Google Ads, Facebook, Email, etc.)

---

## How Bypass POS / Referrer Works

You can conf

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/platform/tracking-and-attribution-settings/bypass-pos-or-referrer]



---

| Event Type | Cou

```
Invoices
â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”

```
Invoice INV-2024-01

## Billing FAQ


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/billing/faq


# Billing FAQ

Common questions about plans, pricing, and billing.

## Plans & Pricing

### Which plan is right for me?

| Your Situation | Recommended Plan |
|----------------|------------------|
| Small e-commerce, up to 1M events | Starter |
| Growing team, need BigQuery, up to 5M events | Growth |
| Multi-brand retailer, up to 25M events | Scale |
| Large retail group, up to 100M events | Pro |
| Unlimited events, custom requirements | Enterprise |

### Can I try before I buy?

Yes! All plans include a **14-day free trial** with full features. A credit card is required to start your trial, but your card will not be charged during the 14-day trial period.

### Is there a free plan?

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/billing/faq]

# Troubleshooting


## Troubleshooting


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/troubleshooting


# Troubleshooting

Solutions for common issues with SealMetrics tracking and reporting.

---

## Quick Diagnostics

### Check Tracker Installation

1. Open your website in a browser
2. Open Developer Tools (F12)
3. Go to the **Network** tab
4. Filter by `sealmetrics` or `pixel`
5. Reload the page

You should see:
- `t.js` script loading (200 OK)
- Beacon/fetch request to `t.sealmetrics.com` (204 No Content)

### Verify Data Collection

1. Log in to [my.sealmetrics.com](https://my.sealmetrics.com)
2. Go to **Real-time** report
3. Visit your website in another tab
4. Your visit should appear wi

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/troubleshooting]



---

# FAQ


## Glossary


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/glossary


# Glossary

A comprehensive reference of all terms used throughout SealMetrics documentation. For detailed metric formulas and benchmarks, see the [Metrics Reference](/reports/definitions).

---

## A

### Aggregated Data

Data that is summarized so it cannot be linked back to any individual. SealMetrics processes pageviews ("hits") independently without reconstructing user profiles.

### API (Application Programming Interface)

A programmatic interface for extracting analytics data, automating workflows, or integrating SealMetrics with external tools. See the [API documentation](/api).

### Attribution

The method used to assign a conversion to a traffic source. SealMetrics uses last-click attribution, the only model fully compatible with consentless analytics.

### Average Order Value (AOV)

The average revenue per conversion. Calculated as Total Revenue divided by Number of Conversions. See [Metrics Reference](/reports/definitions#average-order-value-aov).

---

## B

### Batch API

A way to execute multiple analytics queries in a single HTTP request, reducing latency and simplifying integrations. See the [Batch API guide](/api/batch).

### Bounce Rate

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/glossary]



## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq


# Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

This section centralizes the most common questions customers, legal teams, and marketers ask about Sealmetrics.

Use the links below to explore detailed answers for each topic.

---

## FAQ Categories

### Consentless Analytics
Learn how Sealmetrics measures 100% of traffic without consent and why it is fully compliant with GDPR and ePrivacy.

[Read more â†’](./consentless-analytics)

### GA4 vs Sealmetrics
Understand data differences, direct traffic inflation, 

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq]



## Consentless Analytics


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/consentless-analytics


# Consentless Analytics FAQ

## How can Sealmetrics measure without consent?

Sealmetrics complies 100 percent with ePrivacy, GDPR, CCPA, and PECR.  
We follow the measurement guidelines established by the AEPD and CNIL.

Sealmetrics is a cookieless tracking system.  
No cookies, no fingerprinting, no cross-session tracking, no personal data.

We only track isolated hits (page views), not user journeys.

---

## Do you track users anonymously?

No.  
We do not track users individually, even anon

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/consentless-analytics]



## GA4 vs Sealmetrics


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/ga4-vs-sealmetrics


# GA4 vs Sealmetrics FAQ

## Why are GA4 and Sealmetrics numbers different?

Because GA4 relies on cookies, consent, and session-based tracking.  
Sealmetrics tracks isolated hits without consent and without cookies.

GA4 loses 50 to 85 percent of data when people reject cookies.  
Sealmetrics measures 100 percent of traffic.

---

## Why is GA4's direct traffic inflated?

If a user accepts cookies mid-journey, GA4 loses attribution and assigns the visit to "Direct".  
Sealmetrics attributes hit

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/ga4-vs-sealmetrics]



## Attribution Model


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/attribution


# Attribution FAQ

## What attribution model does Sealmetrics use?

Last click.

Under privacy regulations, it is the only model that does not require consent.

---

## Why not use multi-touch attribution?

Multi-touch requires identification of users across sessions, which is not compliant without consent.  
Sealmetrics avoids all user-level tracking.

---

## Can Sealmetrics read and attribute UTMs?

Yes.  
UTMs are captured on every hit and stored without any personal data.

---

## Does camp

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/attribution]



## Implementation & Tracking


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/implementation


# Implementation & Tracking FAQ

## How do I install Sealmetrics?

Insert your tracking pixel in the `<head>` of your website or via Google Tag Manager.  
Once added, Sealmetrics begins measuring immediately.

---

## Does Sealmetrics work with Google Tag Manager?

Yes.  
Just ensure the Sealmetrics tag is not blocked by Consent Mode or cookie banners.

---

## Can I track conversions and micro-conversions?

Yes.  
Add event pixels anywhere in your site:

- Add to cart  
- Checkout  
- Form subm

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/implementation]



## Frequently Asked Questions


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/privacy-security


# Frequently Asked Questions

This FAQ provides clear and concise answers to the most common questions about Sealmetrics, how consentless analytics works, and how our measurement differs from traditional tools such as GA4.

---

## Why did you adjust 30% of Direct traffic in GA4?

Direct traffic in GA4 is currently heavily over-attributed.  
When a visitor accepts cookies **in the middle of their journey**, GA4 reassigns that traffic to **Direct** instead of the correct source (organic, paid, so

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/privacy-security]



## Technical Privacy Model


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/privacy-technical


# Technical Privacy FAQ

## What data does Sealmetrics collect?

Only four variables:

- Timestamp  
- URL  
- Referral URL  
- User Agent (not stored)

No IP address.  
No unique identifiers.  
No cookies or local storage.

---

## Do you use fingerprinting?

No.  
No techniques that might identify or re-identify individuals.

---

## Can Sealmetrics reconstruct user journeys?

No.  
Hits are isolated by design.

## How can the country of origin of my visitors be determined without knowing thei

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/privacy-technical]

- Micro-conversions and conversions

Yes.  
Full customizable funnels with percentages and drop-off detection.

---

## Can I track ROAS?

Yes.  
Sealmetrics uses a cost calculator plus revenue tracking for accurate ROAS.

---

## Is there an API?

Yes.  
Full API access for exporting metrics,

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/product]



## Legal & Compliance


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/faq/legal-compliance


# Legal & Compliance FAQ

## Is Sealmetrics GDPR compliant?

Yes.  
Because we do not track individuals and do not collect personal data.

---

## Does Sealmetrics require consent?

No.  
We comply with CNIL and AEPD guidelines for cookieless, consentless measurement.

---

## Do you store IP addresses?

No.  
IP addresses are not stored or used for identification.

---

## Has Sealmetrics undergone audits?

Yes.  
Multiple technical and legal audits validate our privacy-first architecture.



---

## Complete Guide to Cookieless Analytics 2025


URL: https://docs.sealmetrics.com/guides/complete-guide-cookieless-analytics


Website analytics is fundamental to understanding visitor behavior. Yet 87% of German users reject cookie banners entirely, and when combined with active cookie rejections, EU websites lose 60-87% of their analytics data. This represents the critical challenge of modern analytics: how do you capture meaningful insights when cookie-based solutions fail across Europe?

The answer lies in cookieless analyticsâ€”a technical approach that captures visitor data without relying on cookies or requiring consent banners. Unlike traditional analytics that depend on third-party cookies or consent mechanisms, cookieless analytics uses alternative tracking methods to provide complete data capture while maintaining GDPR compliance.

This guide explains how cookieless analytics works, why it matters for your business, and how to implement it effectively. By the end, you'll understand why industry leaders like Sealmetrics are moving toward cookieless tracking as the future of web analytics.

## What is Cookieless Analytics?

Cookieless analytics is a method of tracking website visitors and their behavior without using HTTP cookies. Instead of storing persistent identifiers in user browsers, cookieless analytics platforms use alternative mechanismsâ€”such as session-based identifiers, server-side tracking, or request-based trackingâ€”to maintain visitor context and measure analytics events.

### The Core Difference from Cookie-Based Analytics

Traditional cookie-based analytics (including Google Analytics) stores a persistent identifier in the user's browser. This cookie follows the user across sessions, allowing platforms to build comprehensive visitor profiles. The process works like this:

1. User visits website
2. Analytics code creates a cookie in browser
3. Cookie persists for months or years
4. Each subsequent visit references that same cookie
5. Platform links all visits to same user ID

Cookieless analytics eliminates this dependency. Instead, it might use:

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/guides/complete-guide-cookieless-analytics]

- **Smarter attribution** â€” understand exactly where your conversions come from
- **Enhanced privacy compliance** â€” ready for GDPR, CNIL, UK PECR, and the upcoming EU Digital Omnibus
- **New API** â€” more powerful, better d

... [Read full document at https://docs.sealmetrics.com/changelog]



## Key Differentiators vs Google Analytics 4

| Feature | Sealmetrics | Google Analytics 4 |
|---------|-------------|-------------------|
| Consent Required | No | Yes |
| Cookie Banners | Not needed | Required in EU |
| Data Completeness (EU) | 100% | 13-40% |
| IP Storage | Never | Configurable |
| Data Location | EU only (Dublin) | Global |
| GDPR Compliance | By design | Requires configuration |
| Ad Blocker Resistant | Yes | No |
| Personal Data | Never collected | Collected |
